page.title: 01THE TOWN OF NEW ROMNEY
page.content: NEW ROMNEY IS ONE OF THE FIVE ANCIENT CINQUE PORTS WHICH HAVE HAD SPECIAL PRIVILEGES AND RESPONSIBILITIES FROM THE TIME OF EDWARD THE CONFESSOR.IT HAD A THRIVING PORT UNTIL THE 13C WHEN STORMS CHANGED THE COURSE OF THE RIVER ROTHER AND BLOCKED THE PORT.TODAY THE SEA IS A MILE AWAY FROM THE CENTRE OF THE TOWN. BEFORE THE SECOND WORLD WAR SHEEP FARMING AND FISHING FORMED THE MAIN EMPLOYMENT.NOW THE FARMING IS PRINCIPALLY ARABLE AND DUNGENESS NUCLEAR POWER STATION,LOCAL INDUSTRY AND SERVICES PROVIDE EMPLOYMENT. THE TOWN HAS RETAINED SOME OF ITS OLD BUILDINGS BUT ONLY ST.NICHOLAS REMAINS OF THE ORIGINAL FIVE CHURCHES. NEW HOUSING DEVELOPMENTS ARE BEING BUILT.THERE ARE ABOUT 70 SHOPS AND SERVICES IN THE TOWN CENTRE TO CATER FOR RESIDENTS AND VISITORS.
